docTitle.titlePart:
Modulation of superoxide dismutase by electron donors and
acceptors

byline.docAuthor: Natalia V. Gulyaeva, Andrey B. Obidin and Beniamin S. Marinov*

byline.affiliation: The Institute of Higher Nervous Activity & Neurophysiology, USSR Academy of Sciences,
*The Institute of Biological Physics, USSR Academy of Sciences,

front.div:
The competition between superoxide dismutase (SOD) and nitroblue tetrazolium (NBT) for 0; radicals
in the presence of a number of physiologically active compounds was studied. The Na+ channel blockers,
ajmaline, tetracaine, bipuvacaine, lidocaine and etmozine produced an increase in the amount of 0, react-
ing with SOD. Nitroprusside, ferricyanide, BAY K8644, levomycetin, cGMP, CAMP and GMP acted in
the opposite way. All the SOD activtors had in common the property of being electron donors in the reac-
tions with the light-induced free radicals of eosin whereas the SOD inhibitors behaved as electron acceptors.
The electron activity of SOD modulators correlated qualitatively with their regulating efficacy.
front.keyword: Superoxide dismutase; Electron donor; Electron acceptor
